topic: Why a Medieval French Pig Was Once Put on Trial for Murder

Section1.title: The Bell Tolls in Falaise
Section1.summary: You wake to a hush in the village of Falaise, where townsfolk gather near the gallows—eyes not on a man, but a pig in chains.

Section2.title: Blood in the Street
Section2.summary: You step through cobbled lanes, where rumor spreads: a child is dead, and the culprit wears a snout and hooves.

Section3.title: The Bailiff Arrives
Section3.summary: You watch as a stern bailiff approaches, parchment in hand, prepared to summon a sow to court as though it were a man.

Section4.title: The Law of Beasts
Section4.summary: You sink into the records of canon law and custom, where the boundary between man and beast blurs in ink and judgment.

Section5.title: A Pig Behind Bars
Section5.summary: In a dark, straw-littered cell, you glimpse the accused—tethered and silent—as the village prepares for trial.

Section6.title: The Judge’s Gavel Falls
Section6.summary: You sit in a cold, stone courtroom as robed men declare the pig’s crimes aloud, weighed by legal ceremony and belief.

Section7.title: A Lawyer for the Sow
Section7.summary: To your astonishment, a learned advocate rises to defend the pig, quoting scripture and philosophy in its favor.

Section8.title: The Town Watches in Silence
Section8.summary: You feel the eyes of peasants and nobles alike, drawn by equal parts curiosity and dread as testimony unfolds.

Section9.title: Echoes of Guilt and Innocence
Section9.summary: You hear villagers speak of past trials—roosters burned, bulls hanged—and wonder what justice truly means for beasts.

Section10.title: Verdict at Dusk
Section10.summary: As lanterns flicker, you stand still as the judge proclaims the pig guilty, with the weight of law behind every word.

Section11.title: A Sentence Like Any Other
Section11.summary: You witness the solemn rituals of execution prepared—not for a man, but for a creature treated as one under heaven.

Section12.title: The Gallows and the Crowd
Section12.summary: Under grey skies, you watch the sow led forth, her fate sealed as villagers clutch their children and cross themselves.

Section13.title: After the Rope Tightens
Section13.summary: The air hangs heavy as the crowd disperses; you are left with questions lingering louder than judgment.

Section14.title: Justice or Spectacle?
Section14.summary: You explore the echoes of this event—how fear, law, and ritual coalesced into a performance masked as justice.

Section15.title: The Pig That History Remembered
Section15.summary: Centuries pass, but you still hear the tale whispered in legal texts and taverns—a pig whose trial reflected the soul of its age.
